reviews.text: This is a regular Comfort Inn, not very new but not too old either. It would need some renos in the rooms but that being said, it is very clean, no issue there. This is one of the few locations of te chain in the Maritimes that does not offer the Continental breakfast, free wifi is available though. There is a Jungle Jim restaurant attached to the hotel so you can get breakfast there but remember that it adds to the price of the stay. Staff is great, location is also good if you have to stop on the way somewhere, right off the highway, no need to go in the middle of town. The only negative is the sleep quality, mattress is very hard and not as comfortable as other Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: Regular Comfort Inn - Good stay

reviews.text: Clean room and friendly staff made this one night stay pleasant. Our room was clean and tidy and large enough for two couples to stay happily. We were blown away by the view from our room and could have stayed in our room all night. Thanks so much.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: Stayed one night. Got in late, left early but a very quiet and comfortable nights sleep.Very clean room, friendly staff and would have no issue with staying there again.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Attached restaurant, service station next door and a MacDonald's for coffee next to that. No complaints.
reviews.title: I like it
Reasonable place to stay
reviews.text: I like the place its really in good location , rooms are clean , bed was comfortable , jungle jim eatary is there and they serve nice food and if I return to corner brook again I would stay in comfort inn for sure

This hotel is about a 30 minute walk to the university, which I would never attempt in the winter! It is very near a McDonalds and small mall. It is a small hotel and the staff is small, I arrived at the same time as other people which meant it took a little while to check in. Many people expect to be able to walk in to this hotel without a reservation, however, a conference for 500 was in town when I stayed there which meant the hotel was fully booked. Restaurant attached which serves decent family fare. Room was very dated, clean but stuck in the 80s, bedspread pilly and worn, some stains on the desk chair, etc. Seeing the key entry, I went out an outside door thinking I could walk around, when I turned to get back in, on closer inspection the guts were hauled out of it and I couldn't get back in! There is no elevator. You can open doors on the first floor and sit outside, which creates some noise on the city facing side, although people seem to like the view. You can get good prices through the Comfort Inn website, so that does make it decent value.
reviews.title: Worn but clean

reviews.text: This hotel is located as you enter Corner Brook from the Trans Canada Hwy. Not within walking distance of downtown. The only restaurants are in the hotel next door and the Jungle Jim attached to the Comfort Inn.
reviews.title: Room and Staff were good, location and services not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This causes the problem - no continental breakfast at this hotel because of Jungle Jims. There is a MacDonalds next door.
reviews.title: Hello?

reviews.text: Fridge in the room is an extra charge.
reviews.title: Good value for the price

reviews.text: Free coffee and tea but no milk or cream only the disgusting powdered creamer even though there is a fridge where the coffee and tea are.
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: Stayed on a Friday night back in February. Extremely loud until 5 am. Called front desk to complain but nothing accomplished. Walls are paper thin. Got refund for full amount of stay next morning upon check out. First offered half back, but in the end got full amount refunded.
reviews.title: Loud...Loud...Louder

reviews.text: Was like staying over night in a college dorm. Never again. Tonight 09 March 2013, I see on Facebook a friend of mine posting about a very loud and uncomfortable hotel. I asked her is she was staying at the "Comfort Inn" and surprise...she said yes. You need more staff and security on the weekends. I will not be staying at this hotel as well as not recommending this place.
reviews.title: Average Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel in February, 2013. The room was basic and a little dated but clean. The hotel does not have many ammenities that you would expect (i.e. gym, pool, continental breakfast) but I knew that when I booked it so there was no disappointment. The staff was friendly. No complaints but don't expect luxury.
reviews.title: Will return

reviews.text: Writing this while it's still fresh in my mind. Stayed there last night.(November 30-2012) Rather then return home from a day of shopping over a snow covered Highway we decided it would be fun to stay at Corner Brook overnight and get more early morning shopping in the next morning. The Comfort Inn was just that (comfortable) Only negative thing we could say was that the Internet Service was terrible. Other then that,a great stay.
reviews.title: Comfort Inn Cornerbrook NL

reviews.text: Friendly staff clean hotel ,but very disappointed with the services offered or not by the Hotel,its not the staffs fault, but there is no continental breakfast offered ,standard at every other comfort Inn I have visited, I refuse to pay $11 dollars for an omelette at the attached Jungle Jim's,no Fridge or Microwave in the rooms,although there is one of each in reception,The internet is abysmal with a speed of 0.2 of a mb this is not High speed internet by any stretch of the word. My last gripe,there are very very few TV channels mainly News or shopping channels, no digital only analog channels, not even Space, History,HGTV,which are standard at comfort inns across the maritimes. I am a choice Diamond Elite member so have visited very many comfort inns, for service's offered this is the worst.which is a shame because the staff are very good.
reviews.title: Fine but not great

reviews.text: Stayed here for one night this month - room 202 is dated with worn bedspreads and one bedskirt that was dirty with holes. This room is upstairs, directly across from the stairwell, and directly over the front desk. The air-conditioner in this room did not work, nor did the heat. As such, there was no "white noise" to block the noise from the corridor or the front desk during the night. My husband slept with headphones in and had a great sleep, but no such luck for me. Check in was quick, but the lady who served us, "Tammy," was not welcoming, cheerful or warm. Our friends were served by another lady who was quite friendly. We were able to avail of the "biker rate" which was okay.
reviews.title: Okay but Little Sleep!

reviews.text: Stayed there 3 nights in July and 1 night in August Rooms are somewhat dated but clean and comfortable. Rooms on main floor have patio doors which, for me, was great. Always nice to be able to let some fresh air in as most hotels nowadays do not have windows that open :( ladies on front desk at check in and check out were nice. Not much noise, but I guess that depends where your room is situated. I'd stay there again. Restaurant below is jungle Jim's! Over all, I'd recommend this place.
reviews.title: Comfortable and clean

reviews.text: This was my first trip to Newfoundland for a good friend's wedding. I arrived on Aug 2, 2013 around noon or a little after and checked out Aug 5, 2013 a little after 11 am. I was on a strict budget and liked the price of the Comfort Inn, Corner Brook. I'm a travel consultant and have stayed in many types of accommodations over the years.
reviews.title: Cheap and Cheerful

reviews.text: My experience with this hotel was pleasant and what you would expect from a hotel in the 2-2.5* range. What I like to call cheap and cheerful. Although my check in experience was less than stellar due to a form of payment mix-up, they did their best to rectify the situation and it by no means ruined my stay. The beds were exceptionally comfortable in a well-worn, slightly dated but clean room. My view of the harbour and the city were beautiful.
reviews.title: Home Away from Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The housekeeper Maria was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed each day. I wish I could remember the name of the lady who checked me out because she deserves to be mentioned for her kind and enthusiastic demeanor at the front desk.
reviews.title: Good basic accomodation
